alert.note: Alert for Highland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 03 at 4:17PM EST until March 03 at 6:30PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of South Central Ohio and Southwest Ohio, including the following counties, in South Central Ohio, Highland. In Southwest Ohio, Brown. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 417 PM EST, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hillsboro, Greenfield, Mount Orab, Lynchburg, Leesburg, Sardinia, Russell, New Market, Mowrystown, Fayetteville, Highland, St. Martin, Danville in Highland County, State Route 136 at US Route 62, Buford, Samantha, Highland County Airport, Chasetown, Greenbush and State Route 32 at US Route 68.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
